Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman drove in the tying runs in a five-run rally in the fifth, after errors by Aaron Judge and Anthony Volpe and a critical blunder by Gerrit Cole
Mookie Betts later brought in the winning run with a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning
Walker Buehler finished off the Yankees with his first career save, fanning Alex Verdugo for the final out
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers got their looks against the Yankees in this series, even if there were times when they struggled to capitalize
The Yankees' bullpen was pushed to its limits, especially Clay Holmes who managed a scoreless seventh inning
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: Freddie Freeman tied a World Series record with 12 runs batted in
Clay Holmes pitched for the fifth time in five games this series
Gerrit Cole started strong before a tumultuous and gaffe-filled fifth inning shifted the momentum
